words.definition: To alternate means to switch back and forth between two things.
words.example: The best exercise alternates muscle and heart strengthening.

words.definition: If someone is apologetic, they are sorry about something.
words.example: The boy felt apologetic after losing his sisterâ€™s favorite toy.

words.definition: If something or someone is benign, they do not hurt anyone.
words.example: Many spiders look scary, but most are actually benign.

words.definition: To char means to burn something so that it becomes black.
words.example: The chef charred the meat on the grill.

words.definition: To clarify means to make something easier to understand.
words.example: The teacher clarified the instructions for the assignment.

words.definition: Distress is a feeling of great pain, worry, or sadness.
words.example: The news caused her a lot of distress.

words.definition: If someone is dogged, they are determined and do not give up easily.
words.example: He has a dogged determination to succeed.

words.definition: To ensue means to happen after something else, often as a result.
words.example: A fight ensued after the argument.

words.definition: To gasp means to breathe in suddenly because of shock or pain.
words.example: She gasped in surprise when she saw the gift.

words.definition: To negotiate means to try to reach an agreement through discussion.
words.example: The two countries are negotiating a peace treaty.

words.definition: An overdose is a dose of medicine or drug that is too large.
words.example: The singer died of a drug overdose.

words.definition: Persuasion is the act of convincing someone to do or believe something.
words.example: She used her powers of persuasion to get what she wanted.

words.definition: To relay means to pass a message or information to someone else.
words.example: He relayed the news to his family.

words.definition: Reluctance is a feeling of not wanting to do something.
words.example: She showed a lot of reluctance to join the club.

words.definition: To restate means to say something again in a different way.
words.example: The teacher restated the main points of the lesson.

words.definition: Sesame is a plant with seeds that are used in cooking.
words.example: The bread was covered in sesame seeds.

words.definition: To sip means to drink something in small amounts.
words.example: She sipped her tea while reading a book.

words.definition: The verge of something is the point where it is about to happen.
words.example: The company was on the verge of bankruptcy.

words.definition: If you are wary, you are careful because you think there is danger.
words.example: The cat was wary of the stranger.

words.definition: To waver means to be uncertain or to change your mind.
words.example: She did not waver in her decision.
